Pure library

Pure library is a collection of different packages and classes, that can be used in Java projects.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
chav1961.purelib.basic
This package contains a set of classes for the basic abilities of the library.
chav1961.purelib.basic.annotations
This package contains all annotations for the ConsoleCommandManager class
chav1961.purelib.basic.exceptions
This package contains all exception definitions for the the library.
chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays
This package contains a set of growable arrays for all primitive types (except boolean) Differ to List<?
chav1961.purelib.basic.interfaces
This package contains all interfaces for the basic abilities of the library
chav1961.purelib.enumerations
This package contains all enumerations used in the library
chav1961.purelib.examples
This package contains a set of examples for some pure library classes.
chav1961.purelib.fsys
This package contains a set of FileSystemInterface implementations and a factory to get access to them.
chav1961.purelib.fsys.interfaces
This package contains description of general File system interfaces.
chav1961.purelib.i18n
This package contains a set of classes needed for the internationalization.
chav1961.purelib.streams
This package contains a set of classes and interfaces to support stream processing of the different sorts.
chav1961.purelib.streams.char2byte
This package contains a set of output streams, that get character content and convert it to the appropriative byte content.
chav1961.purelib.streams.char2byte.asm  
chav1961.purelib.streams.char2char  
chav1961.purelib.streams.charsource
This package contains a set of classes that implement CharacterSource interface
chav1961.purelib.streams.chartarget
This package contains a set of classes that implement CharacterTarget interface
chav1961.purelib.streams.interfaces
This package contains a set of interfaces to support stream processing of the different kinds
chav1961.purelib.ui  
chav1961.purelib.ui.annotations
This package contains all annotations for the ui abilities of the library
chav1961.purelib.ui.interfaces  
chav1961.purelib.ultralight  

Pure library is a collection of different packages and classes, that can be used in Java projects. This library is based on Java JRE only and doesn't use any third-party libraries. It was one of the main goals when this library was developing. In the most of cases, it's classes are oriented to maximal performance, so many of them have an old-styled program code. They also oriented to use standard Java mechanisms, protocols and so on...

Library content

chav1961.purelib.basic package

This package contains classes to simplify quick parsers development and to simplify development of the console-oriented stand-alone applications. It contains a 'pluggable' class loader to implement easy-to-use plugin mechanism in your applications, a class, that simplified processing of the console commands (it parses console command according to it's syntax, finds appropriative command processor and execute it), a set of logger facades (because of the ZOO of the logger projects, that is a real problem now). It also contains 'smart' Property class, that supports property substitutions and automatic data type conversions, some classes that can be used in quick parsers (including quick tree to manipulate lexemas and names) ûand quick character reader for line-by-line data processing. A special utility class supports some usable functions in the programming practice.

chav1961.purelib.growablearrays package

This package supports a set of growable arrays to use in the quick parsers. It usability is specialized on the well-known task: quick filling of the array's content with the data and longer using them as 'constant' data. Differ to List functionality, growable arrays supports only primitive types without any wrapping.

chav1961.purelib.fsys package

This package supports a 'File system' abstractions for the different kings of it's 'substrate'. This concept is similar to File system concept in the Java 1.7, but extends it to the wide range of data stores: files and file systems, RMI connections, URL-based connections, database content and so on. In the extension of the pure library you can find a lot of the additional 'file system' implementations. File systems also supports Linux-styled mounting, that allow you to make heterogenous file system tree to use it in your program.

chav1961.purelib.i18n package

This package supports concept of the multilingual strings.

chav1961.purelib.streams package

This package supports Java I/O concept of the streams. The 'root' package contains class, that supports stream parsing of the JSON content by XML SAX style. It also contains utility class to build JSON SAX-style handlers for quick-and-simple deserialization JSON content into Java classes

Subpackages of this package contain different kind of the streams-convertors. Main idea of them is to make on-the-fly conversion from data written from one format to another. All the streams are 'ordinal' I/O streams and don't require a special case to use. Subpackages contain a markdown-->HTML converotr, Creole-->HTML convertor, and also Java bytecode Assembler, that converts assembly byte code to byte[], containing class description for use with ClassLoader.defineClass(String,byte[],int,int) method
